articles.title: There are thousands more UK deaths than usual and we don’t know why
articles.description: Since April, there have been 22,500 more deaths than expected in the UK. Health experts are concerned but unsure of the causes – which could include covid-19, population ageing and NHS problems
articles.content:
By Jason Arunn Murugesu
Average waiting times for ambulances peaked at 9 minutes 35 seconds in July
ANDY RAIN/EPA-EFE/Shutterstock
The UK has seen an unexplained surge in deaths in recent months, … [+397 chars]

articles.title: Most major carbon capture and storage projects haven't met targets
articles.description: Most of 13 flagship existing CCS schemes worldwide, representing 55 per cent of captured CO2, have either failed entirely or captured much less CO2 than expected
articles.content:
By Adam Vaughan
The Gorgon gas project in South Australia
CHEVRON
Several of the worlds biggest projects capturing and storing carbon dioxide are significantly underperforming, according to an ana… [+3442 chars]

articles.title: Camera trap images reveal the hidden wildlife of New York City
articles.description: A collection of motion-triggered cameras in Brooklyn and Long Island is bringing ecologists closer to understanding how wildlife distribution evolves on urban landscapes
articles.content:
By Corryn Wetzel
A deer captured by cameras placed in the New York City area 
MILES DAVIS
There are animals hiding in New York City, and ecologist Myles Davis plans to find them.

articles.title: Ukraine's army of hackers failed to thwart Russia and quickly gave up
articles.description: As Russia invaded Ukraine, much was made of Ukraine's volunteer "hacktivist" army, but an analysis of cyberattacks against Russia suggests they achieved little more than minor digital graffiti
articles.content:
By Chris Stokel-Walker
The role of the digital battlefield in the Russia-Ukraine war is unclear
Shutterstock/ViennaVectors

articles.title: Two-legged dinosaur from Zimbabwe is the oldest ever found in Africa
articles.description: A predecessor of the long-necked sauropods named Mbiresaurus raathi provides clues about how climate restricted the range of early dinosaurs

Artistic reconstruction of Mbiresaurus raathi, which has been discovered in Zimbabwe

articles.title: Our neighbouring planets can help us understand Earth's climate change
articles.description: Studying the atmospheres of Venus and Mars can help us learn how Earth's climate will look in the future, says David Grinspoon
articles.content:
By David Grinspoon
Michelle Durbano
VENUS and Mars are the closest we will ever come to controlled experiments for Earth. Take three rocky planets, two roughly the same mass, one about one-tenth of… [+430 chars]

articles.description: The Artemis I launch is planned for 3 September. NASA official Thomas Zurbuchen says it will be a test of the heat shield, communications and propulsion of the Orion spacecraft

articles.title: NASA made enough oxygen on Mars to last an astronaut for 100 minutes
articles.description: NASA’s MOXIE experiment on Mars has produced about 100 minutes’ worth of breathable oxygen, raising hopes for future crewed missions

articles.title: DeepMind AI learns to play soccer using decades of match simulations
articles.description: An artificial intelligence learned to skilfully control digital humanoid soccer players by working through decades worth of soccer matches in just a few weeks

articles.title: Magnetic gearbox could power robots to crawl or jump inside your body
